characters.name: Heather Granville
characters.bio: Heather has always been perfect-perfectly petite, perfectly blond, perfectly polite. Perfect, perfect, perfect. If even the teeniest, tiniest thing in her life isn't perfect, it gives Heather a headache. Sometimes her headaches get so bad it feels like something is trying to dig its way out of her skull. But even that doesn't wipe the perfect smile off of her face.
characters.bio2: Heather's older sister is friends with Jenny- why, Heather doesn't really know. After all, Jenny's certainly NOT perfect. Heather knows Flash and Professor Longfellow from school. Vivian is a friend of her mother's, has been for years. Heather's greatest fear is that she isn't actually perfect after all.

characters.name: Jenny LeClerc
characters.bio: Jenny is a quiet girl. She loves soccer, but sometimes she's too shy to cooperate with her teammates the way she should. Jenny's greatest pleasure is curling up alone in a tiny place reading a gigantic book- the older the book, the better. The books keep her from dwelling on her mother's disappearance, that day fourteen years ago when Mom went to the store and never came back, leaving Jenny alone. Alone forever.
characters.bio2: Jenny's only real friend is Caitlyn, Heather's older sister. Jenny also knows Ox, since she grew up only a few doors away from him on Mulberry Lane. And Jenny knows Madame Zostra from the library, a place they both adore. Jenny's greatest fear is being trapped in a crowd or lost out in the open.

characters.name: Ox Bellows
characters.bio: Ox Bellows was always a big kid. Never got beaten up. Always did the beating up... but only when he had to do it. (Well, except for that one time.) Ox doesn't like to think about that, but the blood and screams creep into his dreams on the cold, lonely nights. His greatest fear is of the dark.
characters.bio2: Ox has known Jenny since they were kids growing up on Mulberry Lane. He met Professor Longfellow at Greenwich University. Ox has known Father Rhinehardt all his life. He's been confessing his sins to the priest since he was small (except for that one sin he doesn't like to talk about).

characters.name: Darrin Flash Williams
characters.bio: Flash isn't the most original name even for someone as fast as Darrin. But he likes it. It's comfortable and fits him, just like his favorite pair of track shoes. Darrin lives to run and runs to live. When he's not running, Darrin feels like there's something coming for him... something Not Good. Even when he runs, the wind sometimes whispers in his ears, and he swears he can hear the Not Good Thing coming up behind him- fast. No wonder he's the star of the track team.
characters.bio2: Flash knows Jenny from the neighborhood. She's ok, but she's real quiet. He's known Madame Zostra for his entire life. After all, he's her nephew. Zoe's his little cousin, but he's only met her a couple of times. Darrin's greatest fear is that he's going to be caught by the Not Good Thing (whatever it is).

characters.name: Vivian Lopez
characters.bio: Vivian's perfect day is to get up late, have coffee and doughnuts, and then ride one of her horses all day. Unfortunately, she doesn't get to spend too many days like that, since she's so busy trying to keep her little used book store from going under. Some days she gets so frustrated she just feels like burning the place down, or maybe just burning down the little shed out back... or the school. But she'd never do anything like that. Still, sometimes she has nightmares about striking the match...
characters.bio2: Vivian is a friend of Heather's mother, Sarah. She also knows Madame Zostra and Father Rhinehardt as customers at her little book store, Something Written. For extra money, Vivian has been babysitting Missy Dubourde at least once a month for the past few years. Vivian's greatest fear is of fire... and her fascination with it.

characters.name: Madame Zostra
characters.bio: Madame Zostra, or 'Belladina' (as her mother named her), has been a tarot and tea-leaf reader since college. She started out working part time sitting in the window of an occult bookstore, but now she has her own home astrology business. Although Madame Zostra reads cards for a living, she won't ever read her own cards. She is terrified that she'll see her own death in the cards, something she can't bear to think about.
characters.bio2: Madame Zostra is familiar with Vivian and Father Rhinehardt from seeing them at Vivian's bookstore. Flash is her nephew, and she never fails to buy him birthday and Christmas gifts. She sees Jenny regularly at the library. Zoe's mother comes to Madame Zostra for tarot readings. Madame Zostra is terrified of death... particularly her own.

characters.name: Missy Dubourde
characters.bio: Missy can't remember wanting to be anything except for a doctor. Her favorite gift ever in the whole wide world was her first doctor's kit. She practices 'medicine' on anyone who will let her. She even cuts up dead frogs and stuff she finds in her yard. But sometimes that gets bad, and she dreams of dead frogs hip-hopping into her bed at night and smothering her. Then she screams.
characters.bio2: Missy knows Peter (and his gross bug collection) from school. She knows Father Rhinehardt from Sunday school (he talks funny and smells like chocolate). Missy lives in the same neighborhood as Brandon. He delivers her family's paper but she doesn't really know him. (She thinks he's cute, though.) Missy's greatest fear is of dead things coming back to life and hunting her.

characters.name: Zoe Ingstrom
characters.bio: Zoe likes to play in her room with her dolls. Each doll has its own name, family, history, pets, and everything else a doll needs to be happy. Zoe helps her dolls play out little dramas, mostly happy ones, but sometimes the dolls get mad at each other and hit. Not that Daddies would ever hit Mommies. That doesn't happen. Leastways, you're not supposed to talk about it when it does. So, Zoe plays with her dolls.
characters.bio2: Flash is Zoe's cousin, but she doesn't know him real well. Zoe's mom goes to Madame Zostra for tarot card readings. Zoe likes playing with her dolls under the table there. Zoe's family sometimes goes camping with Brandon's family. But Zoe doesn't like it, so she mostly stays in the tent and plays with her dolls. Zoe's greatest fear is of the boogeyman... whoever he is.

characters.name: Peter Akimoto
characters.bio: Peter's two favorite places in the world are the basketball court and under his house. He likes the basketball court because that's where he can play his favorite game. He likes being under the house because it's a great place to hunt for bugs, plus it's a good place to avoid his five older brothers. Sure, all older brothers pick on their younger siblings, but Peter's brothers really pick on him. But what's a few broken bones among family? Peter loves bugs and wants to be an entomologist when he grows up- an entomologist who never has to speak to his brothers.
characters.bio2: Peter earns extra money taking care of Professor Longfellow's yard (and finding cool bugs- bonus!). He knows Missy from school. She likes to do pretend medical exams on him and check out his real broken bones, but she doesn't like it when he shows her his bug collection. Peter's greatest fear is that he'll get trapped somewhere and never be able to escape.

characters.name: Brandon Jaspers
characters.bio: Brandon loves computers and camping. He takes his new laptop with him wherever he goes. That way he can program AND camp at the same time. Cool. Brandon's never liked playing with regular toys, action figures, or that kind of thing. In fact, he hates puppets. He had a clown puppet when he was little, and some mornings when he woke up, he'd find it had moved closer to him. Once it even had a kitchen knife in its hand. Brandon's pretty sure his big brother, Chris, was messing with him. But he still hates puppets.
characters.bio2: Brandon sometimes sees Zoe's family when they go camping. Zoe usually hides in the tent with her dolls, though. Yuck. Brandon delivers the newspaper to Professor Longfellow (in his big old freaky house) and to Missy's family. Brandon's greatest fear is of puppets, particularly clown puppets.

characters.name: Professor Longfellow
characters.bio: Professor Josiah Longfellow is very proud of his aristocratic roots. His family used to have money... at least until his father lost it all on gambling and alcohol. The Professor still lives with his aging mother in the rundown Victorian that used to be the finest house in town. His father disappeared one day. Ran out. His mother has a rather large life insurance policy, but of course, he doesn't want to collect on it any time soon, no matter how nice the money would be.
characters.bio2: Professor Longfellow knows Ox, Flash, and Heather from the university. Brandon is his paperboy. Peter mows the yard and takes care of other petty chores around the house. The Professor's greatest fear is that he will lose everything that he has, proving to everyone that he's no better than his deadbeat father.

characters.name: Father Rhinehardt
characters.bio: Father Rhinehardt was born in Munchen, Germany (or Munich, as Americans call it). He moved with his family to America when he was 15... and then got beaten up for the next three years. Father Rhinehardt turned to religion for the reasons why people treated him so badly. Eventually, he entered Seminary and became a priest. Since that day, long ago, many people have confessed their sins to him. But there is one man who haunts him, every few years, a stranger who sits in the confessional and whisperes of murder and madness. In recent years, Father Rhinehardt has found he's starting to agree with the madman's arguments. Blood, pain, death- they are all part of life, of God's plan, are they not?
characters.bio2: Father Rhinehardt is familiar with Vivian and Madame Zostra from seeing them at the Something Written bookstore. He knows Ox from hearing him confess his petty sins. He also knows Missy from her appearances at Sunday school. More than anything, Father Rhinehardt fears going mad.

omen-cards.flavor: A skull, cracked and missing teeth.
omen-cards.description: You find a glowing skull on the ground. Make a haunt roll now.
Gain 2 Might. Make a haunt roll now.

omen-cards.flavor: This mangy dog seems friendly. At least you hope it is.
omen-cards.description: Gain 1 Might and 1 Sanity now. Lose 1 Might and 1 Sanity if you lose custody of the dog. Make a haunt roll now.

omen-cards.flavor: A growl, the scent of death. Pain. Darkness. Gone.
omen-cards.description: When you draw this card, something bites you. You try to defend against this mysterious something, but it runs away into the darkness. Lose 1 Might. This omen can't be dropped, traded, or stolen. Make a haunt roll now.
Gain 2 Might and lose 1 Sanity now. Lose 2 Might and gain 1 Sanity if you lost custody of the madman. This omen can't be dropped, traded, or stolen. Make a haunt roll now.

omen-cards.flavor: A girl. Alone. Trapped. You free her!
omen-cards.description: Gain 1 Sanity and 1 Knowledge now. Lose 1 Sanity and 1 Knowledge if you lose custody of the Girl. This omen can't be dropped, traded, or stolen. Make a haunt roll now.

omen-cards.flavor: A diary or lab notes? Ancient script or modern ravings?
omen-cards.description: Gain 2 Knowledge now. Lose 2 Knowledge if you lose the Book. Make a haunt roll now.

omen-cards.flavor: A symbol of calm in an unsettling world.
omen-cards.description: Gain 2 Sanity now. Lose 2 Sanity if you lost the Holy Symbol. Make a haunt roll now.

event-cards.flavor: What's around your ankle? A bug? A tentacle? A dead hand clawing?
event-cards.description: You much attempt a speed roll. 4+ You break free. Gain 1 Speed. 1-3 Lose 1 Might. 0 Lose 1 Might and 1 Speed.

event-cards.flavor: You feel a body under your foot. Before you can leap away from it, you're knocked over. A giggling voice runs away from you.
event-cards.description: Lose 1 sanity.

event-cards.flavor: Smoke billows around you. You cough, wiping away tears.
event-cards.description: Smoke fills the room and blocks line of sight from adjacent rooms. Lose 1 speed.

event-cards.flavor: Mother and child, still embracing.
event-cards.description: Take 1 die of mental damage. Attempt a Sanity roll to search the Skeletons: 5+ Gain 1 Knowledge. 0-4 You dig around, but find nothing. Take 1 die of mental damage.

event-cards.flavor: A spider the size of a fist lands on your shoulder...and crawls into your hair.
event-cards.description: You must attempt a Speed roll to brush it away or a Sanity roll to stand still: 4+ It's gone. Gain 1 in the trait you used to attempt that roll. 1-3 It bites you. Take 1 die of physical damage. 0 It takes a chunk out of you. Take 2 dice of physical damage.

event-cards.flavor: It emerges from the slime on the wall next to you.
event-cards.description: You must attempt a Speed roll: 5+ You get away. Gain 1 Speed. 2-4 Take 1 die of mental damage. 0-1 Take 1 die of mental damage and 1 die of physical damage.

event-cards.flavor: It starts like a whisper, but ends in a soul-rending shriek.
event-cards.description: You must attempt a Sanity roll. 4+ You resist the sound. 1-3 Take 1 die of mental damage. 0 Take 2 dice of mental damage.

event-cards.flavor: There's something odd about this room, but what? It's tickling the back of your mind.
event-cards.description: Attempt a Knowledge roll: 4+ A section of wall slides away, revealing an alcove. Gain 1 Knowledge. 0-3 You can't figure it out, and that makes you a bit crazy. Lose 1 Sanity.

event-cards.flavor: A man on fire runs through the room. His skin bubbles and cracks, falling away from him and leaving a fiery skull that clatters to the ground, bounces, rolls, and disappears.
event-cards.description: You must attempt a Sanity roll: 4+ You feel a little hot under the collar, but otherwise fine. Gain 1 Sanity. 2-3 Out, out, you must get out. Put your explorer in the Entrance Hall. 0-1 You burst into flames! Take 1 die of physical damage. Then take 1 die of mental damage as you put out the flames.

event-cards.flavor: Behind a portrait is a wall safe. It is trapped, of course.
event-cards.description: Attempt a Knowledge roll to open the Safe. 5+ You open the Safe. Gain 1 Knowledge. 2-4 Take 1 die of physical damage. The Safe won't open. 0-1 Take 2 dice of physical damage and the Safe falls on you.

event-cards.flavor: A baby's cry, lost and abandoned. A scream. The crack of breaking glass. Then silence.
event-cards.description: Roll 6 dice. If you roll equal to or more than the number of omens that have been revealed, you gain 1 Sanity. If not, take 1 die of mental damage.

event-cards.flavor: There is an old mirror in this room.
event-cards.description: Your frightened reflection moves on its own. You realize it is you from another time. Your reflection writes on the mirror: THIS WILL HELP, then whispers something to you. Gain 1 Knowledge.

event-cards.flavor: You turn to see a man in groundskeeper clothing. He raises his shovel and charges. Inches from your face, he disappears, leaving muddy footprints, and nothing more.
event-cards.description: You must attempt a Knowledge roll. (An explorer in the Gardens rolls 2 fewer dice on this roll.) 4+ You find something in the mud. Gain 1 Knowledge. 0-3 The groundskeeper reappears and strikes you in the face with the shovel. The groundskeeper rolls a Might 4 attack against you. You defend against this attack as normal, by rolling dice equal to your Might.

event-cards.flavor: Mists pour out from the walls. There are faces in the mist, human and...inhuman.
event-cards.description: Attempt a Sanity roll: 4+ The faces are tricks of light and shadow. All is well. 1-3 Take 1 die of mental damage. 0 Take 2 die of mental damage.

event-cards.flavor: 'I'm under the floor, buried under the floor...' The voice whispers once, then is gone.
event-cards.description: You must attempt a Knowledge roll: 4+ You find something under the floor. Gain 1 Knowledge. 0-3 You dig and search for the voice, but to no avail.

event-cards.flavor: A phone rings in the room. You feel compelled to answer it.
event-cards.description: Roll 2 dice. A sweet little granny voice says: 4 'Tea and cakes! Tea and cakes! You always were my favorite!' Gain 1 Sanity. 3 'I'm always here for you, Pattycakes. Watching...' Gain 1 Knowledge. 1-2 'I'm here, Sweetums! Give us a kiss!' Take 1 die of mental damage. 0 'Bad little children must be punished!' Take 2 dice of physical damage.

event-cards.flavor: There is an old mirror in this room.
event-cards.description: Your frightened reflection moves on its own. You realize that it is you from another time, and you are in trouble! You need to help, so you write something on the mirror. Lose 1 knowledge in order to help yourself.

event-cards.flavor: The smell in this room, it's horrible. Smells like death, like blood. A slaugherthouse smell.
event-cards.description: You must attempt a Sanity roll: 5+ Troubling odors, nothing more. Gain 1 Sanity. 2-4 Lose 1 Might. 1 Lose 1 Might and 1 Speed. 0 You double over with nausea. Lose 1 Might, 1 Speed, 1 Knowledge, and 1 Sanity.

event-cards.flavor: This room is warm. Flesh-like walls pulse with a steady heartbeat. Your own heart beats with the rhythm of the house. You are drawn into the walls...
event-cards.description: You must attempt a Sanity roll: 4+ You blink, and the walls have returned to normal. Gain 1 Sanity. 2-3 The vision disturbs you. Lose 1 Sanity. 0-1 You are stuck in the wall. Lose 1 Sanity and 1 Might as you struggle to break free.

event-cards.flavor: A breeze chills the room. Before you, three men hang from frayed ropes. They stare at you with cold, dead eyes. The trio swing silently, then fade into dust that falls to the ground. You start to choke.
event-cards.description: You must attempt a roll for each trait: 2+ That trait is unaffected. 0-1 Lose 1 from that trait. If you roll a 2+ on all 4 rolls, gain 1 additional point in a trait of your choice.

event-cards.flavor: You see an open coffin. You're inside it.
event-cards.description: You must attempt a Sanity roll: 4+ You blink, and it's gone. Gain 1 Sanity. 2-3 The vision disturbs you. Lose 1 Sanity. 0-1 You're really in that coffin. Lose 1 Sanity and 1 Might as you dig yourself out.

event-cards.flavor: A thousand bugs spill out on your skin, under your clothes, and in your hair.
event-cards.description: You must attempt a Sanity roll: 5+ You block, and they're gone. Gain 1 sanity. 1-4 Lose 1 Sanity. 0 Lose 2 Sanity.

event-cards.flavor: The closet door is open...just a crack. There must be somethig inside.
event-cards.description: Roll 2 dice to open the Closet. 4 Gain 1 Knowledge. 2-3 Draw an event card. 0-1 Draw an omen card.

event-cards.flavor: The walls of this room are damp with blood. The blood drips from the ceiling, down the walls, over the furniture, and onto your shoes. In a blink, it is gone.
event-cards.description: You must attempt a Sanity roll: 4+ You steel yourself. Gain 1 sanity. 2-3 Lose 1 Sanity. 0-1 In a fit of insanity, you punch the wall. Lose 1 Sanity and 1 Might.

event-cards.flavor: You see a vision of a ghostly couple walking the grounds silently strolling in their wedding best.
event-cards.description: You must attempt a Knowledge roll: 5+ You recognize the ghosts as former inhabitants of the house. You call their names, and they turn to you, whispering dark secrets of the house. Gain 1 Knowledge. 0-1 You pull back in horror, unable to watch.

rooms.name: Tower
rooms.text: Attempt a might roll of 3+ to cross, if you fall you stop moving.

rooms.name: Gallery
rooms.text: You can choose to fall to the bedroom if it is in the house, if you do- take one die of physical damage.

rooms.name: Catacombs
rooms.text: You can attempt a sanity roll of 6+ to cross, if you fail you stop moving.

rooms.name: Chasm
rooms.text: You can attempt a speed roll os 3+ to cross, if you fail you stop moving.

rooms.name: Junk Room
rooms.text: When exiting, you must attempt a might roll of 3+, if you fail lose 1 speed but continue moving.

rooms.name: Chapel
rooms.text: Once per game, if you end your turn here gain 1 sanity.

rooms.name: Gymnasium
rooms.text: Once per game, if you end your turn here, gain 1 speed.

rooms.name: The Pentagram Chamber
rooms.text: When exiting, you must attempt a knowledge roll of 4+, if you fail lose 1 sanity but continue moving.

rooms.name: Library
rooms.text: Once per game, if you end your turn here, gain 1 knowldge.

rooms.name: Attic
rooms.text: When exiting, you must attempt a speed roll of 3+, if you fail lose 1 might but continue moving.

rooms.name: Furnace Room
rooms.text: If you end your turn here, take 1 point of physical damage.

rooms.name: Graveyard
rooms.text: When exiting, you must attempt a sanity roll of 4+, if you fail lose 1 knowledge but continue moving.

rooms.name: Larder
rooms.text: Once per game, if you end your turn here gain 1 might.

rooms.name: Crypt
rooms.text: If you end your turn here take 1 poing of mental damage.

rooms.name: The Vault
rooms.text: You can attempt a knowledge roll of 6+ to open and empty the vault.

haunts.flavor: You found a spirit board. The planchette slides back and forth, back and forth across the letters, moving without anyone's aid. You stare in horrified fascination as it spells out: B U R I E D A L I V E.  Looking around, you realize that you haven't seen your friend since you entered this house. Some twisted magic must have prevented you from remembering! If your friend really is buried alive, you must find that person now.
haunts.whatYouKnow: The house has buried your friend in a basement room, but you don't know which room the person is buried in.
haunts.youWinWhen: ...you find and dig up the buried person before he or she dies.
haunts.how: Each time you move into a room, your friend will step closer to death. Once you've found the burial room, you can hit enter to attempt to dig.
haunts.ifYouWin: Digging frantically, you finally free your trapped friend. Your companion's fingernails are broken-splintered from clawing at the wooden coffin-and blood runs down their shaking hands. Your friend hasn't made a sound since being freed. Slowly you help them out of the house, sure that with the proper care, they will be good as new...someday.
